sections.title: Landlord Entry Requirements
sections.text: Landlords must provide at least 48 hours written notice before entering a rental unit, except in cases of emergency. The notice must specify the date, approximate time, and purpose of entry.

sections.title: Security Deposit Requirements
sections.text: In Washington, DC, security deposits must be refundable and returned within 45 days of lease termination with itemized deductions if any. All deposits must be held in an interest-bearing escrow account. Landlords cannot make deposits 'generally non-refundable' or exercise unilateral discretion over returns, which conflicts with tenant protection laws.

sections.title: Lease Renewal Requirements
sections.text: Leases cannot automatically renew without explicit tenant consent. Tenants must receive written notice at least 30 days before lease expiration if the landlord wishes to renew or change terms.

sections.title: Protection Against Retaliatory Eviction
sections.text: Landlords cannot evict tenants in retaliation for exercising their rights, such as filing complaints about housing code violations, joining tenant organizations, or requesting repairs.

sections.title: Warranty of Habitability
sections.text: Landlords must maintain rental units in habitable condition, including working heat, plumbing, electricity, and compliance with all housing codes. Tenants may withhold rent if landlords fail to make necessary repairs.
